articles.title: 18-year-old injured in R.I. after lighting himself on fire for TikTok challenge
articles.description:
The man and a friend were apparently trying to copy a video they watched on Instagram of a person attempting the challenge.

The post 18-year-old injured in R.I. after lighting himself on fire for TikTok challenge appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: An 18-year-old man was injured in Rhode Island while attempting a TikTok challenge.
The incident occurred after he and a friend copied a video seen on Instagram.
Local authorities warn Boston residents about the dangers of viral social media challenges.

articles.title: US Naval Academy is on lockdown following reports of threats
articles.description:
“The base is on lockdown out of an abundance of caution. This is a developing situation and we will provide updates as they become available.”

The post US Naval Academy is on lockdown following reports of threats appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: US Naval Academy in Annapolis is on lockdown due to reported threats as of September 11, 2025.
Authorities are taking precautions to ensure safety for students and staff on campus.
Boston residents should stay informed as the situation develops and impacts local security measures.

articles.title: ‘Fear and uncertainty’: Everett officials cancel Hispanic Heritage Month festival amid ICE crackdown
articles.description:
The Fiesta Del Rio, which was supposed to be held Sept. 20, was cancelled due to “recent ICE raids” surrounding Everett.

The post ‘Fear and uncertainty’: Everett officials cancel Hispanic Heritage Month festival amid ICE crackdown appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Everett officials cancelled the Fiesta Del Rio festival scheduled for September 20.
Cancellation due to recent ICE raids causing fear in the community.
Local residents lose a key cultural celebration impacting community cohesion.

articles.title: Josh Kraft ends mayoral campaign after coming in second by nearly 50 points in Tuesday’s preliminary
articles.description:
“I’m proud we brought out the issues that matter most to voters and gave voice to those too often left out. We challenged the status quo."

The post Josh Kraft ends mayoral campaign after coming in second by nearly 50 points in Tuesday’s preliminary appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Josh Kraft ended his mayoral campaign after finishing second in the preliminary election.
He lost by nearly 50 points to the leading candidate on September 11, 2023.
Kraft's campaign highlighted important voter issues, influencing future political discussions in Boston.

articles.title: Josh McDaniels defends Drake Maye: ‘He’s the right guy’ for Patriots
articles.description:
"It's got to be a long-term vision of where this guy is gonna be. He's gonna be a really good player."

The post Josh McDaniels defends Drake Maye: ‘He’s the right guy’ for Patriots appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Josh McDaniels supports rookie quarterback Drake Maye as a long-term asset for the Patriots.
McDaniels emphasized Maye's potential to become a 'really good player' for the team.
This endorsement may influence fan support and expectations for the Patriots' future performance.

articles.title: Authorities in a Connecticut town want to speak with whoever is painting the squirrels
articles.description:
The furry animals, who “appear to be okay,” were apparently painted in the area of Naubuc Avenue and High Street, according to East Hartford Animal Control. 

The post Authorities in a Connecticut town want to speak with whoever is painting the squirrels appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: East Hartford Animal Control reports painted squirrels spotted near Naubuc Avenue and High Street.
Authorities seek to identify the person responsible for painting the squirrels.
Residents are urged to report any information to ensure animal safety.

articles.title: 2 Mass. teachers reportedly on leave for reactions to Charlie Kirk’s death
articles.description:
"Just a reminder, we're not offering sympathy," one of the teachers allegedly wrote in a personal Instagram.

The post 2 Mass. teachers reportedly on leave for reactions to Charlie Kirk’s death appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Two Massachusetts teachers are reportedly on leave following controversial social media posts.
One teacher allegedly stated, 'we're not offering sympathy' regarding Charlie Kirk's death.
This incident raises concerns about teacher conduct and social media use in Boston schools.
